prompt: Create a real-time chat application backend server using node.js, express.js, websockets, typescript, file system based key-value db and local file system storage. Let's start with basic project setup
Add chat application specific events like send/receive message, user management etc. Also, all the events and client info should be saved in db.

Reorganize the websocket code in different directory and db related code in different directory. Add the support for users onboarding with basic user details and username & password based authentication as well as allowing users to continue as guest/annonymous.

use express.js MVP architecture like controllers, models/db related code, middlewares, routes, services etc. and reorganize the project files. Also, use ts-node and nodemon instead of ts-node-dev. Also, add endpoints for user profile management - CRUD apis, without delete.

Add endpoints fetch list of available chat rooms as well as the room particular user has joined. Also, add the functionality for public rooms and private rooms. All users can see public and private chat rooms but only autheticated users are allowed to join private rooms whereas public rooms can be joined by any users. Whenever a new user joins the room, broadcast the new user to all the room members.

Add support to share images in the chat room. Use local file system to upload and serve files, set max upload size to 5 MB. Also, update the README.md for all the supported features and make sure it's updated after each update.

Reorganize the code to keep all the type definitions under src/types directory. Create a script to test all the client-server features, endpoints, websocket events, uploads etc. whatever current code is supporting. Also, update README.md with all the available endpoints, websocket events, project structure, and all other related information which can help a new developer or reviewer to understand the project better. Also, add a postman collection to run and test all endpoints and websockets events with example request and response. Make it compatible in a postman runnable  format if needed, add postman scripts(if required) to manage user session during runs.
Write the unit test cases for the complete codebase and generate a coverage coverage report.

Test cases failing with error: TS1343: The 'import.meta' meta-property is only allowed when the '--module' option is 'es2020', 'es2022', 'esnext', 'system', 'node16', 'node18', 'node20', or 'nodenext'. Make sure that all test cases are passing

Now convert this backend into a ready to use sdk and bundle it as an npm package(local build only for now, no npm publish). Expose all the features/functions/endpoints as sdk methods, allow to configure data or db path and upload limits.
Create a example app in <root_dir>/example demonstrating the usage and working of all the sdk features.

Extend the app to support edit and delete messages, typing indicators and user online/offline status. Make necessary additions/modifications in api endpoints, websocket events etc. Also, make sure that all the modifications are supported by sdk and updated in README.md also.
typing indicators, online/offline status (User.isOnline, WS events). SDK methods added (editMessage, deleteMessage, etc). README updated. These functionalities are not completed.
